channel.title: Mod Rewrite Help
channel.description:
Well I am thinking of buying another domain and want the document root of it to be something else on the same server. Something very similar here:
For HTTP/1.0 requests there is no solution, but for HTTP/1.1 requests which contain a Host: HTTP header we can use the following ruleset to rewrite http://www.username.host.com/anypath internally to /home/username/anypath: RewriteEngine on RewriteCond %{HTTP_HOST} ^www\.[^.]+\.host\.com$ RewriteRule ^(.+) %{HTTP_HOST}$1 [C] RewriteRule ^www\.([^.]+)\.host\.com(.*) /home/$1$2
Can anyone redo this so that when someone accesses my site from [b]"something.com"[/b], everything such as index.php comes from the folder [b]"/something/"[/b] and when they access from [b]"mainsite.com"[/b] it comes from the main folder [b]"/"[/b]. PS- no redirect i want it invisible

item.title: Mod Rewrite Help
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

add a virtual directory in the httpd.conf

Read full topic

item.title: Mod Rewrite Help
item.dc:creator: @belbn belbn
item.description:
@belbn wrote:

Well I am thinking of buying another domain and want the document root of it to be something else on the same server.

Something very similar here:

For HTTP/1.0 requests there is no solution, but for HTTP/1.1 requests which contain a Host: HTTP header we can use the following ruleset to rewrite http://www.username.host.com/anypath internally to /home/username/anypath: 
RewriteEngine on
RewriteCond   %{HTTP_HOST}                 ^www\.[^.]+\.host\.com$
RewriteRule   ^(.+)                        %{HTTP_HOST}$1          [C]
RewriteRule   ^www\.([^.]+)\.host\.com(.*) /home/$1$2</blockquote>

Can anyone redo this so that when someone accesses my site from “something.com”, everything such as index.php comes from the folder “/something/” and when they access from “mainsite.com” it comes from the main folder “/”.

PS- no redirect i want it invisible

Read full topic
